page.title: 14EDUCATION Post Primary
page.content: At the age of eleven the children leave the local primary school and travel by bus or train to secondary schools in the town of Sleaford or Billingborough, a village nine miles to the south. The children are selected either for the grammar schools,Carre's Boys or Kesteven and Sleaford Girl's High, or secondary modern schools,The Aveland School Billingborough or St.George's School Sleaford. Between the ages of sixteen and eighteen further education is provided by a joint sixth form in Sleaford or colleges of further education in Grantham,Lincoln or Boston. Of the six secondary schools in the area(those above and Ruskington Sec.Modern and The Lafford School, Billinghay)it is likely that two will close due to a 14% fall in numbers.
